CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking into account the fact that both IDT and NT are comparatively rigid coplanar structures along the polymer backbone , the IDT-NT based polymers may suffer solubility issue since the tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents. Therefore , the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains were introduced in between IDT and NT units to improve the solubility of the resulting polymers , which may also potentially lead to improved molecular weight that is favorable for the optimal morphology and charge carrier transport. 39-41 We notice that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units , 42,43 which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap and lower the charge carrier mobility. 40,41 However , it should be tried several different alkyl side chains to achieve a delicate balance of the molecular weight , solubility as well as planarity of polymers as no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains. 44,45 It was realized that by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units , the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and film morphology can be optimized. Further investigation of photovoltaic performances indicates all devices present high V oc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers , and the highest PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT . Differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ; see Figure 1 ) were used to probe thermal properties. No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities. Optical and Electrochemical Properties. The UV - vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution ( 1 × 10^-3 mg mL -1 ) and as thin films ( spin - casted from chlorobenzene solutions with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 ) are shown in Figure 2. All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands , where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit , while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the IDT and the NT segments. 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

Let's think step by step.

1. polymer backbone
2. tetraoctylbenzene groups
3. alkyl side chains
4. spacers
5. thiophene or bithiophene
6. IDT unit
7. NT unit
8. carbon bridges
9. HOMO energy levels
10. π-π* transition of the IDT unit
11. intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between the IDT and the NT segments
12. chlorobenzene solution (CB)
13. thin films
14. UV - vis absorption spectra.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. polymer backbone
2. tetraoctylbenzene groups
3. alkyl side chains
4. spacers
5. thiophene or bithiophene
6. IDT unit
7. NT unit
8. carbon bridges
9. HOMO energy levels
10. π-π* transition of the IDT unit
11. intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between the IDT and the NT segments
12. chlorobenzene solution (CB)
13. thin films

I removed the entities that are not clearly related to material names, such as UV-vis absorption spectra, DSC analysis, TGA analysis, and figures. These entities are related to measurements and analysis methods, not material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymer backbone |
| tetraoctylbenzene groups |
| alkyl side chains |
| spacers |
| thiophene or bithiophene |
| IDT unit |
| NT unit |
| carbon bridges |

| intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between the IDT and the NT segments |
| chlorobenzene solution (CB) |
| thin films |

Paragraph: Taking into account the fact that both IDT and NT are comparatively rigid coplanar structures along the polymer backbone , the IDT-NT based polymers may suffer solubility issue since the tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents. Therefore , the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains were introduced in between IDT and NT units to improve the solubility of the resulting polymers , which may also potentially lead to improved molecular weight that is favorable for the optimal morphology and charge carrier transport. 39-41 We notice that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units , 42,43 which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap and lower the charge carrier mobility. 40,41 However , it should be tried several different alkyl side chains to achieve a delicate balance of the molecular weight , solubility as well as planarity of polymers as no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains. 44,45 It was realized that by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units , the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and film morphology can be optimized. Further investigation of photovoltaic performances indicates all devices present high V oc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers , and the highest PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT . Differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ; see Figure 1 ) were used to probe thermal properties. No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities. The UV - vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution ( 1 × 10^-3 mg mL -1 ) and as thin films ( spin - casted from chlorobenzene solutions with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 ) are shown in Figure 2. All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands , where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit , while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the IDT and the NT segments. 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

14. Linear hexyl side chain.

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking into account the fact that both IDT and NT are comparatively rigid coplanar structures along the polymer backbone , the IDT-NT based polymers may suffer solubility issue since the tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents. Therefore , the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains were introduced in between IDT and NT units to improve the solubility of the resulting polymers , which may also potentially lead to improved molecular weight that is favorable for the optimal morphology and charge carrier transport. 39-41 We notice that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units , 42,43 which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap and lower the charge carrier mobility. 40,41 However , it should be tried several different alkyl side chains to achieve a delicate balance of the molecular weight , solubility as well as planarity of polymers as no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains. 44,45 It was realized that by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units , the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and film morphology can be optimized. Further investigation of photovoltaic performances indicates all devices present high V oc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers , and the highest PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT . Differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ; see Figure 1 ) were used to probe thermal properties. No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities. Optical and Electrochemical Properties. The UV - vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution ( 1 × 10^-3 mg mL -1 ) and as thin films ( spin - casted from chlorobenzene solutions with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 ) are shown in Figure 2. All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands , where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit , while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the IDT and the NT segments. 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

Let's think step by step.
1. "tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents" -
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Value of Material Property: tetraoctylbenzene groups (number of carbons = 8), solubility in common organic solvents.

2. "the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains" -

Value of Material Property: various alkyl side chains (unit: not specified in the text).

3. "may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap" -

Value of Material Property: band gap.

4. "charge carrier mobility" -

Value of Material Property: charge carrier mobility.

5. "no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains" -

Value of Material Property: influences of specific side chains.

6. "processability, backbone planarity, charge carrier mobility and film morphology" -

Value of Material Property: processability, backbone planarity, charge carrier mobility, film morphology.

7. "high V oc" -

Value of Material Property: V oc (Open-circuit voltage).

8. "PCE of 5.05%" -

Value of Material Property: PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency).

9. "decomposition temperature (defined as the 5% weight-loss temperature, Td) over 450 °C" -

Value of Material Property: decomposition temperature (Td) over 450 °C.

10. "All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands" -

Value of Material Property: dual characteristic absorption bands.

11. "the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit" -

Value of Material Property: short wavelength absorbance, π-π* transition.

12. "the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between the IDT and the NT segments" -

Value of Material Property: long wavelength absorbance, intramolecular charge transfer (ICT).

13. "PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm" -

Value of Material Property: absorption maximum of PIDT - EHNT = 599 nm.

14. "PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm" -

Value of Material Property: absorption maximum of PIDT - DTNT = 608 nm, absorption peak of PIDT - DTNT = 439 nm.
